commit message: Made dagger methods static so its easyer for it to build the graph.
Don't call observeOn main thread for play state as we are already on the main thread.
Recalculate the dimens only in onBoundsChange
No longer write to disc and also don't call the false channel detector on startup
Use a fresh extractor for each iteration.
Implemented a class that decides which media player can be used.
Move the player itself to a separate library
Observe player events on main thread so the receiver can stay safely on their thread.
Use the various methods of the callback instead on handling the parsing ourself.
Subscribe on mainthread for controller stop.
Apply the number picker theme directly to the class.
Moved image picker stuff to own layout
Added a home button and react to clicks on the refresh icon.
Show a better message when there is a network failure.
Updated some dependencies and removed unused stuff
In debug mode, log to storage.
Dont lazy init media session as the first call has to be done from the ui thread.
Add a log menu item when in debug.
Cache the logs and store only up to 1000
Added a timestamp to the logs
Only request the audio focus if we don't already hold it.
Set the sender factory public so acra can instantiate it.
Always handle book id on main thread. Fixes synchronization issue

Heavily decreased object creation in production mode.

By implementing a handler which uses a inline function to call the timber methods only when there are trees planted.
Get double click time from view configuration
If the book was playing, play again after click on bookmark.
Added build config class to acra
Use a combination of the book details to determine the location for the cover. This lets us decouple it from the books itself.
Jump to current state when transform is called.
Separated the cover collector from the book adder and use the file walk class for simple deep visiting.
Use kotlins file walk to iterate over the containing files.
